intro: Hieracium pilosella subsp. subvirescenticeps, commonly known as the green-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy basal rosette. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom from late spring to early summer. This subspecies is known for its distinctive greenish-yellow floral coloration and is often found in meadows and grassy areas.
